Package it.polimi.ingsw.model.cell

Class Cell

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.ingsw.model.cell.Cell
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AmmoCell, SpawnCell
    public abstract class Cell
extends java.lang.Object
    The Cell is the unit of space on the Board. Cells are organized in a 2-dimensional lattice space, forming a grid of 10 ~ 12 units that fits in a bounding box spanning 4 units horizontally and 3 units vertically. The coordinate system used to identify Cells is a clockwise pair of axes with the x coordinate increasing to the right and the y coordinate increasing downwards. Cells are grouped into Rooms, this is important when evaluating visibility between two Cells.
    See Also:
    Room, Board

        See Also:

      • distance

        public int distance​(Cell cell)
             throws NullCellOperationException
        This method tells the distance between two cells. The distance between two cells is defined as the length of the shortest possible walk between them. A walk between cells is a sequence of steps, where every step connects a cell to its neighbour, and two consecutive steps must have a cell in common (i.e. the walk must be unbroken). The distance between a cell and itself overrides the previous definition and is defined to be 0.
        Parameters:
        cell - the target cell.
        Returns:
        the distance between the cell this method is called upon and the cell passed as argument.
        Throws:
        NullCellOperationException - when passing a null cell.

      • isAdjacent

        public boolean isAdjacent​(Cell cell)
                   throws NullCellOperationException
        This method tells if a cell is adjacent to another cell. A cell is adjacent to another cell if and only if the distance separating them is equal to 1. This implies a cell is not adjacent to itself. An adjacent cell may also be referred to as a neighbour. Note that this relationship is symmetrical (i.e. if cell A is adjacent to cell B, then also cell B is adjacent to cell A).
        Parameters:
        cell - the comparison cell.
        Returns:
        whether or not the cell this method is called upon is adjacent to the cell passed as argument.
        Throws:
        NullCellOperationException - when passing a null cell as argument.
        See Also:
        distance(Cell)

      • canSee

        public boolean canSee​(Cell cell)
               throws NullCellOperationException
        This method tells if a cell is visible from another cell. A cell can see another cell if and only if it belongs to a Room containing any of the first cell's neighbours. A cell can always see itself.
        Parameters:
        cell - the target cell.
        Returns:
        whether or not the cell this method is called upon is able to see the cell passed as argument.
        Throws:
        NullCellOperationException - when passing a null cell as argument.

      • isAligned

        public boolean isAligned​(Cell cell)
                  throws NullCellOperationException
        This method tells if a cell is aligned with another cell. Two cells are aligned if there exists a straight path (ignoring walls) that includes both cells. In order for the path to be straight, either of its coordinates must remain constant along its span, meaning that any two cells sharing a coordinate are aligned. This implies a cell is aligned to itself.
        Parameters:
        cell - the comparison cell.
        Returns:
        whether or not the cell this method is called upon is aligned with the cell passed as argument.
        Throws:
        NullCellOperationException - when passing a null cell as argument.

      • isBetween

        public boolean isBetween​(Cell cell1,
                         Cell cell2)
                  throws NullCellOperationException
        This method tells if a cell is between two other cells. A cell is between two other cells if there exists a straight path (ignoring walls) including all three cells, such that the cell is the second one encountered on this path, when run across in either direction. A cell is considered between itself and another cell. A cell is also considered between itself and itself.
        Parameters:
        cell1 - the first comparison cell
        cell2 - the second comparison cell
        Returns:
        whether or not the cell this method is called upon is between the two cells passed as arguments.
        Throws:
        NullCellOperationException - when passing a null cell as argument.
        See Also:
        isAligned(Cell)
